channel.title: Posts on MacReiben Web Zone
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on MacReiben Web Zone

item.title: 2023 to 2025
item.description: A blog post on my career in IT every two years. It’s a good trend. Some significant stuff happend … .

item.title: Podman resources wave 1
item.description: Following Docker recent changes I switched to podman. This post is set of resources organized by topic.

item.title: Enable Linger
item.description: Some common use case with podman. Once the connection is closed, the containers stops running.

item.title: 2021 to 2023
item.description: Too much time since I wrote something here. It’s been two years. In the meantime I used more twitter than the blogs now.

item.title: 2019 to 2020
item.description:
A long time since I posted new content. What happened since 2018 ? I finished my mission at Qualcomm Life and started the next one at Ostrum Asset Management.

I’m workin on a legacy application. Why did I choose this ? Thing is I’m really fund of DDD (Domain Driven Design).

item.title: Domain Driven Design BBL at Qualcommlife Paris
item.description:
I’ve done a BBL version of my DDD introduction talk in Qualcomm Life Paris.

This one was very challenging because I had to compress a two hour talk in one hour.

I’m looking forward to present it again. The slides are here.

Next event, DDDEurope 2019 Amsterdam, as a visitor :).

item.title: How to fail inheritance
item.description:
Inheritance abuses bores me. I’m sorry to tell this, but IT teaching is often responsible.

The course usually say something like this:

When behaviour is used in several classes, then create a root class and put your code in there in a protected method. So all the children classes can reuse the behaviour.

So inheritance is solving the reusability problem.

I learnt to code this way, with a bunch of animals as examples.

item.title: Green addict
item.description:
I use tests frameworks all the time. Whether I do TDD or try a code sample. It’s the faster way isn’t it ?

I become a “green addict”. I feel unconfortable when I’m not seeing green dots on my test runner - or when I do not see red dots when I change code (which frightens me much more).

item.title: DDD Europe 2018
item.description:
I was at the DDD Europe conference this year. I’m very interested in design oriented conference.

I have the feeling that the conference was not really about design, but about changing minds, point of view and improve ones understanding.

item.title: MSBuild: Copier un dossier avec wildcards
item.description:
This is a little trick to copy files from a regular expression with MSBuild.

With this example it becomes possible to use wildcards to identity to elements to copy.

item.title: Js Design Pattern Book
item.description:
I found this interesting free EBook online:

  • Essential JS Design Pattern

Nice and easy :).

item.title: The bad good ideas by Arnaud Lemaire
item.description:
I found out this nice presentation in Arolla Mai 2016 press review:

  • SpeakerDeck - Arnaud Lemaire - les fausses bonnes id√©es

To savour copiously !

item.title: Clean Coder Giving Up on Tdd
item.description:
Or why people are giving up on TDD by Uncle Bob Martin.

This post is great source of arguments to explain TDD to your team mate. Also it contains a lot of arguments to convince them to use TDD.

item.title: Dev life: catchphrases
item.description:
There are often a lot of funny thing I hear during mettings.

  • “You should be solution oriented, not problem oriented.”
  • “The managers have converted the tee shirt size to days.”

We can use tee shirt sizes to compare a task complexity with another task.
